website_summaries.verdict: Unless you prefer a 2-piece scoop set, this is an affordable poop scooper that eliminates the need for 2 tools. A solid deal.
pros: Advanced jumbo version of a popular classic scoop
handle w/mechanism that easily operates the strong jaw
cons: Some owners report that it doesn't work well w/soft messes
The design is a bit bulky and awkward until you master the one-piece unit

customer_reviews.title: Better jaws for bigger dogs...
customer_reviews.text: Better than other 'jaw' scoopers... We got two years out of our last one, a record for these jaw type scoopers. They all are built with some weaknesses, and I've use three or four brands, so far this one is best. Just ordered another. Failure on this one ultimately was the springs breaking. I probably could have found some replacement springs and installed them, but honestly who wants to do repairs on a poop crusted scooper so I'll splurge for the $15 for a new one. Be aware if you use these in the winter, the combination of the plastic getting brittle with the cold and being more aggressive trying to dislodge frozen poops will break them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul From Boulder

customer_reviews.title: Defective product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased less then two months ago and the handle has broken off defective product.
customer_reviews.author: MAMBER

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog POOP Picker Uper
customer_reviews.text: We have two German Shepards and this is the right height and works great my girlfriends says that the handle is a little hard to squeeze so may not easy for Grandma to use but anyone and even kids should be able to use it. We have the Med. one and it works great, not to small. If you have a X-Large dog would be the only reason I would get the big one small to large can use the Med. one with no problems. Side note we use Behrens Manufacturing 6104 Galvanized Steel Locking Lid Can, 4 gal to store the poop in and don't smell it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Long-term assessment
customer_reviews.text: Nothing lasts forever, especially when stressed by changes in season, but this pooper scooper lasted me longer than most. About 3 years originally, and one final year limping along, cracked and super-glued back together. It's longer than most other pooper scoopers, as well, which means you don't need to bend as much when cleaning the yard. For older, achier owners, that's a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: dittyesq

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on November 21st roughly 4 months ago and it has already broken. Both springs broke so it no longer works. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dana C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Springs Snapped First Try
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews about the handle or springs breaking and figured. I'll be gentle on it. This is NO JOKE. The FIRST time I fully opened the device both springs immediately snapped and broke. So, it worked for one opening I guess? I'm going to try to locate or buy some springs and hopefully MAKE the device work. But trust me, the springs and this device are very very fragile. I broke it first try even knowing to not go harsh on it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew O.

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning it because all it was doing what smashing my Corgi's droppings between the teeth. I can do a much better and faster job with a $1 garden shovel and a small bucket. I even had my wife try it to make sure I wasn't just being stupid and it didn't work for her either. Save yourself some time and money and go get a shovel and bucket from the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, but just didn't work for me. Hard to open, needed to much force and would tire my hand out. It was hard to scoop on grass with out tearing up the grass and I wasn't able to pick up the small pieces. The "fresher" pieces got stuck on the jagged edges. I tried on rocks too, but it was hard to just get the pieces and not a scoop full of rocks. I tried using for 1.5 months thinking i just needed to get the rhythm down other reviewers mentioned, but today decided to order the rack and bucket method...hopefully I'll have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scoop. Wish they made small scoop with the long handle.
customer_reviews.text: This has changed my life! I have back problems and it's painful to bend. This is very quick and easy. Love it. The only negative is that it makes no sense that the small dog scooper has a shorter handle. That doesn’t mean the owner is shorter! I really just need a small scoop on a long handle. Hope they will figure that out. The handle length on this scoop I believe is 32”. I am 5’4’ and have to bend slightly at the knees. I still have to give it 5 stars because it works so well. I haven’t had it long enough to rate it on sturdiness and durability. It looks and feels well made.
customer_reviews.author: DesignGirl

customer_reviews.title: Yuck!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this scoop, and while it seems well made, has a nice, long handle, and strong clamping "jaws," but I do not enjoy having to clean dog waste off of the teeth with the hose after every use. My dog routinely has rather firm excrement, so that's not the issue here. I utilized the scoop on pavement, very low grass, and slightly longer grass, only to have the same end result. I will stick to my small shovel and flinging the poo into the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Not for fresh poop in grass of any length. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not for fresh poop in grass of any length. Yes, the jaws close very well. However, unless it's just one turd, the teeth sink into the poop, and when you lift to remove it, it smears the poop along the grass blades. Our yard is not very long, and even after mowing, I have yet to have a clean recovery of any fresh poop. Gross.
customer_reviews.author: TypeAMomof2

customer_reviews.title: Love a Flash Sale
customer_reviews.text: I was able to purchase this on a flash sale - twice. For that, it can't be beat. I like the size of it, as you can pretty much get everything in one scoop, unlike smaller ones I have. The height is also great. Also, when emptying, most stuff comes off easily, and doesn't stick. This has worked well on all surfaces - grass, dirt/mud, and pavement. I have the second one as backup, but the original is still working fine after almost 6 months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: DoggyDoggy

customer_reviews.title: Crappier than the Crap it picks up
customer_reviews.text: A piece of crap that can’t even pick up crap without breaking. Broke in the first day, cheap plastic support section in the “claw” broke in half. Funny thing is, Amazon wants me to return it for refund. It still exudes a tad of Doggie Doo, but whatever, i’m sure they have Hazmat suits or something for returns. It’s not like they’re going to go CSI on the POS plastic support that just picked up crap right? They are going to chuck it in the trash, or maybe waste more gas by shipping back to manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Hater of the Year

customer_reviews.title: Great for poop, not salad.
customer_reviews.text: Already dropped this several time on concrete, not even a scuff. Pick up poop for 2 big dogs in about 10 minutes now! My only complaint is whenever I use this to toss the salad at dinner it kind of smells like dog poop. Maybe include some microbial surfaces so it stays clean and smells fresh... Other than that, great product!!
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW QUINTERO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, sturdiness and durability
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a pooper scooper from Petsmart and it only lasted 5 days, until my kiddo dropped it and it broke. This pooper scooper from Nature's Miracle is study and easy to use. I purchased the medium one for our Red Merle Australian Shepherd Dog name Woody. You will not be disappointed. FYI, I have the pooper scooper hanging, once in awhile, you should lubricate the springs to avoid rusting. My last scooper lasted 13 years. NRHTX
customer_reviews.author: NRHTX

customer_reviews.title: Needs beefed up!
customer_reviews.text: I’m still giving this pooper scooper four stars on the fact that it does work well. We live in Kansas and the other day temperatures were in the teens. As you can see from the picture it snapped towards the base. It has worked well for us over the last couple of years but I’m sure others have probably experienced the same failure. You can see the frame thickness at that stress point is not very significant. We did purchase another one and I will be sure to be extremely careful using it in cold temperatures. Maybe the manufacturer will see this failure and can improve on an already good product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mc

customer_reviews.title: Great pickup!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow, when I first saw it, I thought this thing is huge...but with a lab and a new lab puppy, it’s perfect! Somehow puppies defy science because you put in 10 pounds of food and somehow get 20lbs of poop! This scooper is being put through the test and so far succeeding! I actually waited a few months before reviewing the product and it holding up great. Very good at picking up multiple spots and still has a strong closing action! I’ll buy again if needed,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Product nd Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: What a POS. I had this scooper for only 3 months and the springs have already broke rendering the product useless. I tried contacting the company several times with no success. The phone numbers provided for their customer service do not work and neither does their website. All I want to know is where to get new springs. But I cant get an answer because like the product, the customer service sucks. This is the second time I purchased one of these. They never last long. But 3 months is unacceptable. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best plastic scooper
customer_reviews.text: There are a few different types of pooper scoopers out there. On the low end they are all plastic and on the high end they are metal (aluminum). This is the best plastic scooper I have used. It is very durable and works very well. It lasted me 3 years and was left outside that entire time in Northeast USA weather. It finally broke on me in the 4th year and I replaced it with a metal scooper. The quality is much higher but the price is also 3-4X as much. If you are looking to purchase a cheap plastic scooper that will work well you found the right product!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: For the big jobs
customer_reviews.text: I have two GSDs who can put out some impressive waste, and this scooper is definitely jumbo in size and does the job. I downgraded a star because it seems to be made of cheaper plastic, but then again it is priced below many competitors, especially those sold in the pet stores. Like all scoopers, poop tends to stick on the jaws and any scooper's claim that it is made of nonstick materials is...ds. Overall, I recommend if you have T. Rex-sized dogs like mine.
customer_reviews.author: 8clap

customer_reviews.title: Great for smearing turds into grass!
customer_reviews.text: If the grass is short, and the turds are "placed" crowd-surfing perfectly on the top of the blades, this would actually work. Picture trying to get chewing gum out of your hair with an arcade claw machine - if that sounds rad, then buy this "turd burglar." I'm shocked it's reviews are this good. Might as well just use a shovel or some gloves.
customer_reviews.author: P. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Ready, Aim, Fire!
customer_reviews.text: This device is highly recommended for those who's yard backs up to a green belt, creek, or neighbors you hate. With proper form, this turd catapult is capable of launching doo doo 30 plus feet over your fence. All you have to do is fill the container, "load" you swing way back, let her rip like you are throwing a frisbee, and pull the lever to release. I have found that holding it with both arms, similar to a golf swing, works best for maximum distance and control. Be careful not to overfill as this may cause some stray nuggets that won't make it over. "Turd Chuckin" has now become the highlight of my day. Thank You Nature's Miracle!
customer_reviews.author: The Barth's

customer_reviews.title: No more rake and shovel for us
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. They don't always get as deep down as the rake will, but they are so much easier to use. Plus, if you get the movement down right, you can scoop and launch a good 30 feet, right in to the woods, or unsuspecting neighbors car window, whatever. Much easier than trying that catapult launch maneuver with the other style. You know what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.author: CraigG

customer_reviews.title: Took review down spring broke but still purchasing another one
customer_reviews.text: Spring broke and replaced scooper with another brand didn't cut it. So despite the broken spring ordering a second one. Have some pretty big poops,with a Dane mix. I'm a 70 in pretty good shape except after I had an esophagus repair it is hard to bend over. These are tall and scoop around the entire pile. The other brand scoop would get soiled because grabbing a partial pile is a mess snd the jaw strength on cheaper does hold the weight. These are sturdy. Mine is still like new except the one spring broke. And if anyone can tell me where I can get replacement springs I would appreciate it. these are double the price of other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime P. Lovci

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't broken it yet, so that's a plus. Overall, picking up poop is annoying and disgusting. This makes it a lot easier for me than the traditional scoopers - however, I seem to constantly have some left over inside the scooper part - so it's, well, gross. I tend to pick up one at a time and throw it in a baggie to throw away. I'm sure you could maneuver to pick up multiple poops but I don't have those skills yet. It really does work well for what it's designed to do. :)
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Woud love to rate higher but...
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased three of these now. We bought one for our puppy and one for my dad to use at his home. My dad's broke only after a few months use, spring broke. Had to replace it. Second one seems to be lasting longer. Great capacity for larger dogs. Only complaint is sometimes contents you pick up don't want to fall out when opening the scoop. Spring in the thing is very stiff so if you have arthritis or have weak hand grip you might find it difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C

customer_reviews.title: A little Small for Great Danes. But still better than bags or a shovel.
customer_reviews.text: Great Dane Related - Pros: No more scooping or shoveling poops. Cuts your poop duties in half. Saves Money and space on bags. Cons: Mouth opening is just a bit small for Danes. Just OK construction. I'm expecting it to break in a couple years. It's plastic so, whatever. Fresh Poops will smear. You gotta be REALLY careful when hosing / cleaning this thing, as the poop water will spray everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This scooper is great. Springs have great tension. Made of durable materials. Paid a little that my last one but that sucker didn’t last. You get what you pay for. Went out on limb on this and I’m glad I did. I have two 75 pounds dogs to pick up after. This is easy to use and clean. Handle is even a little longer so it doesn’t make my back hurt to poop scoop! I have arthritis in my hands and it doesn’t hurt using the handles. Would recommend. I think scooper will be around awhile. Thanks for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: ajetgirl

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Do not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Owned less than 2 months and it broke already. This is my second one of these the first one lasted just under a year. The first scooper both springs broke. This time the plastic where the springs connect broke.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser22

customer_reviews.title: It's bulky and a bit cumbersome!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gadget for the obvious, but I've seen pictures of people inserting a plastic bag to do "the job." I did the same and while it works with the plastic bag, it becomes awkward especially when you're trying to dispose of the dong. You remove the bag and then you have to keep cleaning this thing with Clorox and what not. It's also hard to open, which I guess it says something about the good quality of the springs and other components. I just think it's not as convenient to use as I had imagined after all.
customer_reviews.author: norbac

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but poor mechanical design
customer_reviews.text: I can't for the life of me figure out why someone would design a pooper scooper where the springs operate the closing of the scooper cups, rather than having your grip strength close the cups, and relying on the springs to open the cups back up. There's no way little springs can exert enough force to get under poop that has become very matted to the dirt and grass. I'll be sending this back and buying the design I had for the last 10 years where I exert the force of the cups with my grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: If you read other reviews about this item (and similar items) you'll see a bunch of people complaining about how it squishes poop and isnt strong, blah blah blah. Well I'll say that it doesn't work miracles, but it works fine to me. Using it just requires some technique. The end of the scoop is not going to stay clean. Which is fine. I'm not going to make out with it. Or touch it. I leave it outside under the porch out of the rain. It's not a m1 Abrams but the strength seems acceptable. You cant use supreme amounts of force, and neither do you need to. Like I said, technique.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Good dook scooper
customer_reviews.text: Works well for our two Frenchies. I have kept it outside so far and no problems. Good length, avoids bending. Rinses fine. There is definitely an art to it. You want to open the Jaws as little as possible and go as shallow as possible into the grass to get around the target. Using a back and forth twisting motion seems to work the best for leaving as little as possible behind for softer presents. I did not feel pictures were necessary. If you found this review helpful, please mark it to let me know. Feel free to ask any questions.
customer_reviews.author: POWERPRO

customer_reviews.title: Not great for people with small hands
customer_reviews.text: I do like that this scooper is longer than my old one by a couple inches. It’s a bit heavier though. It gets the job done picking up poop. The thing I definitely don’t like about it is that it’s made for people who have medium to large hands. I have small hands, so when I go to squeeze the lever, I pretty much have to do it with my fingertips which wears my hands out fast. The tension is also stronger in the springs, but that could just be because it’s brand new. If you have small hands, this might be tough for you to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bengta Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Love the big scoop
customer_reviews.text: Our old scooper broke so I got a new brand this time! So far we are really pleased with this one. I leave it outside all the time and it get's hit with snow and rain on a regular basis. It's held up very well and the springs are very strong. I like the big scoop for picking up poop easily. Definitely would recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Isom

customer_reviews.title: I AM BUYING IT AS AN INDOOR GRABBER FOR NON-POOP TOO!
customer_reviews.text: I AM REPLACING MY GRABBERS FOR INDOORS FOR THIS POOPER SCOOPER! IT IS PERFECT FOR SOMEONE IN A WHEELCHAIR! I love it. It gets all the poop and the grass and holds it so you can get a few scoops in before you have to dump. And it doesnt smell- it does trap odors but I wouldn't say it's non-stick. But I just spray some cleaner on it and shake it and its clean as new. I am literally going to stop buying GRABBERS for objects *(I'm recently in wheelchair) and just purchase these. If I need to grab stuff around the floor- it's just wonderful inside and outside !
customer_reviews.author: JulietStl

customer_reviews.title: teh 1st one arrived broken, but they replaced it after my scathing review and its a good scooper
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered arrived broken, and I was (and still am) convinced that it was broken before it shipped. So I wrote a scathing (and somewhat rude) one star review, saying that I threw it in the garbage and didn't even bother returning it because I was so disgusted. The manufacturer asked me to contact them (as you can see), which I did, and they sent me a replacement immediately at no charge. This one arrived in tact, and it works very well. It scoops nicely, its got a powerful spring, and it's been durable. Good product and great customer service. Four stars!
customer_reviews.author: sun2bright

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and better then the pet store brand that the handle broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware, if you've got weak hands, the two springs could be difficult to pull open the claws. My Mom (79) said it was to difficult. I imagine small kids could run into the same problem. But for the rest of us, this Medium Jaw is the bomb. Cheaper and better then the pet store brand that the handle broke on. And the last one the spring broke from being left outside. And the xtra large springs were a bit weak. But this one, with the two springs has a lot of closing force. It's 27 1/2 inches from top to turd.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Poop clean up
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have only used the pooper scooper for less than a week. But it has made clean up so effortlessly. Since I’m house training our pup, I have been leaving the last excrement in place for him to return to do his new deed. Once that has been accomplished, I pick up the old poop and toss it out. Which makes grabbing it less messy and disastrous after it’s dried. I would highly recommend and hope that it last a while before having to purchase another one. I have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: This thing picks up S**t like you wouldn't believe
customer_reviews.text: If you told me that you wouldn't have to bend over to either pick up s**t or put down s**t, I would have thought you were pulling my leg. Well, this thing does it and it does it well. Simply pull the handle trigger and open are the jaws ready to pick up some s**t. I like to carry a 5 gallon bucket with me lined with a bag and tote that around to dump the epic craps my 2 large dogs leave me in the back yard. This s**t is literally a game changer. Don't be on the fence, buy yourself one and thank me later!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cyhanick

customer_reviews.title: I use for other chores also
customer_reviews.text: Odd as it may seem I use this to pick up pine cones. I live in the forest on acreage and it's hard to keep up with the pine cones. One day last fall I picked up over 500 freshly fallen cones. I actually use the cones in the woodstove as firestarters. These are large pine cones and I can pick up 5-6 at a time because of the strong teeth of this jaw. (I use a separate one for my dog duty chores). I even ordered one for my neighbor for the same reason. Saves my back, for sure! Ordering another one as a backup after I write this review. All around great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Jarvinen

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy grip, easy release. Important when you're a bit older
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd pooper scooper.. We decided to get one for the backyard as well as the front yard. The other one we purchased was a different brand. That one works fine, but oh my, this one works so much better! It's easy to open the jaws, it picks up the poo easily and releases it just as easily. It's lighter weight than our other one, too. Since we're seniors, we find this one much easier to use. It seems sturdy, we've been using it for awhile now with no issues. It's also pretty red. If you have to scoop the poop, at least you have a pretty tool to do it with.
customer_reviews.author: KarenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Picks up a full border collie dump!
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how wide the jaws open! I can even pick up one poop then go to another and scoop both up since the jaws are so wide. If you have carpal tunnel this wouldn’t be a good option for you obviously. It’s definitely a forearm/wrist/hand work out if you have more than one dog.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: If you have a big dog.  Don't hesitate. Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size. I have had the size below and the even smaller black one. Mind you I have a 60 lb GSD that's 5 months. So I'll leave the rest to your imagination. However. This has been the best one yet. Seems sturdy. Just don't be an idiot with it. But it easily can pick up a doggos BM in one scoop, TWO tops and your done! Toss the poop in an old dog food bag so ya don't stink up your garage but this device is a godsend!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I get this sooner?!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew such things existed. I used a shovel when I was a kid and didn’t know any better. So naive... I recommend you bury the shovel (ha) and get yourself one of these...like...today. Seriously...I would do it now if I were you. When you use it, you’ll smile and think ‘Thank you, girl from Amazon’. But the joke’s on you, I’m actually a 42 year old woman who just found out about dog poop scoops. They remind me of those dinosaur head grabber toys I used to have as a kid. They should make these with dinosaur heads. Its fun AND useful—win, win!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this scooper, but I only love it because my dog has relatively firm/shapely poops and it works great with that. I wouldn't imagine this working well with anything exceedingly soft or shapeless, but then again I can't imagine anything that -would- work well for that. We used this mainly during heavy rain/winter times when our grass was very long and it rained almost every day, and the scooper was still awesome. It'd be even better with shorter grass. Open scooper over poo, then close it and twist away and upwards from the grass. Worked every time!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great value, product and company. Thanks, Dennis & Carla
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent value that works efficiently and is light weight for carrying on a walk. It has powerful clamping ability. Unfortunately it is too powerful for our use and picked up stones and sticks that prevented it from closing. As a result we would lose some of the product we were trying to scoop up. They have gravely refunded our money. We are considering buying the smaller unit. Anyway this is a great company with a great product. We wish them well and thank them for working with us. Dennis & Carla
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mastin

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: I get the idea here but in reality, I wouldn’t want this again for dog poo. It does a good job clamping around the poo to a point but you have to uproot grass as well in order to get everything. I will say it works good after a snowfall since you can grab a poo filled snow ball and heave the lot over the fence. If it’s anything less than solid or frozen, it’s gonna be messy with this thing. Oh and don’t undershoot or else this thing will just guillotine them right in half.
customer_reviews.author: Erin the Destroyer

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is durable.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scooper for over a year now, and it's still great. With 3 dogs (small, medium, & large), I pick up a lot of poop...on grass, gravel, rocks, and dirt. This works for all those surfaces. After a year of nearly daily use, it is still in good shape, no cracks, spring handle still works, plus it's easy to clean off with just a spray from the hose. I store it outside next to the house area, so it apparently resists sun damage well. Wish I had found this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: MYS

customer_reviews.title: This one is perfect length so you don't have to bend over or ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband came home from Petsmart with a more fragile (different brand) scooper... that was $36. I immediately shopped Amazon - found this one. Had him return the other! This one is perfect length so you don't have to bend over or strain your back to use. Durable so far, and very purposeful for our yard & 2 fur children. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: AliG

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this 2 months now and it works like a charm! I’m 5’9” and barely have to bend down to pick up my dogs poo! I have 2 10lb Yorkies and got the Medium size and there is plenty of room to pick up multiple poos before having to put it in the dog poo trash can I also got here on Amazon! Best part my 2 year old loves to go “hunt” for poop so I can pick it up 🤣 As soon as she is able to control the handle I will pass the chore on to her LoL! Bottom line.... just buy it! It’s less than $20 and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a bit to big.
customer_reviews.text: The title above says this is for a Medium, I think I have something larger than that. My old one fit neatly into a plastic grocery bag that I use for cleanup around the yard. A good reuse. This new Jaw Scoop is very sturdy and the spring load pretty heavy AND I can barely get it into the bag requiring a bit more dexterity and good aim on my part. My fault for not checking actual measurements closely.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Rolland

customer_reviews.title: For more than just poo
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this today. My previous scooper had me bending way over and it killed my back. I still have to bend a little with this one (I’m 5’7) but it’s a TON better than my last one. I also used this new tool to pick up all the itty bitty pieces of toilet paper my puppy shredded in the backyard. The claw works great for picking up even the smallest bits of trash. My yard looks so much better now. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RedHeadJKB

customer_reviews.title: No stick, wide jaw Poop Scoop!
customer_reviews.text: Have had several scoops, all had the same major problem, stuff sticks. I didn't buy this for the no stick reason, figuring it was creative advertising, however, stuff doesn't stick hardly at all!! Haven't had to repair this one as the others. It is mostly plastic, not metal, very easy to use the handle opener, nice width on opening and length of the jaws from side to side. The red also makes it easy to spot when you're out on a night run in the winter! Spring kinetic tension is very good as well, it is not a wimpy gripper.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Trying out another Scooper
customer_reviews.text: I am in pursuit of the perfect scooper, if there is such a thing. I am not going to use bags with this, that is an improvement. I am finding the handle a little bit too big for my hand, but not a huge problem for me. I have to figure out the best way to pick up the poop. I find that I trap more in the jaws than in the scoop inside. Maybe that is my learning curve! I like it over all though.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Kling

customer_reviews.title: Great product and terrific customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered our jumbo scoop four years ago, and it's still going strong, even with daily use. Eventually, the tiny metal springs wear out; but I just contact Nature's Miracle, and they send me replacement springs--at no cost! I wish all my experiences with customer service were this good.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Person

customer_reviews.title: More Durable than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this thing would fall apart after a few seasons of abuse, but I was wrong. While lightweight and easy to operate one-handed, this thing has been left out in the elements for many seasons, without any issues. It scoops and grips effectively, has a large enough jaw to complete the job in a single scoop, and messes do not seem to stick to the teeth, making for easy emptying.
customer_reviews.author: Ninazu

customer_reviews.title: The most durable pooper scooper, EVER!
customer_reviews.text: The best pooper scooper ever!!!!! The exact words of my Significant other.... who really wants to pick up a big sized fur babies poop. Not us! He says, “I like that ! It works really •h*lla good! The teeth on the scooper are very sharpe so it gets poop out of tough spots... example: high grass and high weeds. It’s very durable, definitely good quality and worth the money.”
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well built. Sturdy. Rated lower because nonstick mentioned is not accurate. I’ve had to use a stick to remove waste that accumulated during use.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting; Best Way to Clean Up After Your Dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one after 10+ years using the previous model. Plastic and steel spring construction proved very durable. The steel springs gave up before I noticed any significant wear on the plastic basket. I expect the new model to last at least as long. Excellent functional design with wide jaws enables picking up even the largest of my Labrador Retriever's leavings. Also great for picking up other trash in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: M. Otten

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality & Price
customer_reviews.text: This works easily, even on 1" gravel. Couldn't bend over to pick up the poops due to hip surgery and this was a life saver that I used until I was allowed to bend again. It is a nice weight, easy to operate, and easy to empty. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This scooper changed my world!
customer_reviews.text: When my old (and shorter) scooper bit the dust, I wanted to get a replacement quickly. Dog poop stops for no one! To the rescue - the trusty Nature's Miracle scooper! Much longer than my old scooper - no more bending over! Spring action is excellent, scoops work well, even with the most stubborn turds! Yard has never looked better, and my back never felt better! Get this and change your world!
customer_reviews.author: restorick

customer_reviews.title: Built strong and can survive the weather in the backyard.
customer_reviews.text: Going strong for the year now. I store it outside so it gets rained on the times and frozen and the temperature drops. Nothing is falling apart, no corrosion, nothing breaking apart. a little bit bigger than other ones I've used, but that's a good thing cuz I have two best sounds that have really healthy sized droppings. Easy to use with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: mrverhoef

customer_reviews.title: good quality!
customer_reviews.text: great quality, only thing i would mention is: if you've got a mid sized dog and their poops aren't terribly large, i wouldn't go with the jumbo size. its just more cumbersome to pick up their doody. i have 3 frenchies who are 20-25 lbs and the jumbo sized pooper picker is a little much for their tiny doodoos. make it easier on yourself, even if its 85 cents more to get the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Tea farmer east Texas

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick because wha?
customer_reviews.text: I gave this less than five stars for ease of use because the distance between grips is too far for my hands and makes squeezing the grip harder. But it’s larger “bite” is perfect for the gifts my behemoth dog leaves me. Note: I don’t get the non-stick name. Poo-is-poo and poo-sticks
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but others work better.
customer_reviews.text: This works well, but there are better ones out there. I bought this to replace my old one (I forget the brand), but my old one was better at closing and staying closed once you grabbed the poop. This one won't close fully through a big patch of grass, which defeats the purpose a bit. You end up closing the claws around 90% of the poop, causing you to smear and leave poop around the grass. I almost want this thing to rip out some of the grass rather than leave a smear of poop in my yard. Wish it had a stronger closing force.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Salvato

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: This one is larger than my old one! But, makes short work of picking up poop from 5 dogs! Buy the springs for a replacement, as over a few years they stretch, and this will last forever! Rinses off easily with a hose. I have used my old one exactly like this, (a little smaller) for 4 years, and need to replace the 2 springs now. ...but it still works!
customer_reviews.author: Charl8

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a dirt and rock backyard and it is very hard to clean up the dogs waste without picking up a lot of rocks to, when I got this it was so much easier and quicker to get it done. I didn't pick up hardly any rocks/dirt and when I did you just kind of rock it back and forth like a sifter and it falls out. I don't know how long this has been out but I wish I had it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Smashes poop into scoop
customer_reviews.text: It is nice not to have to bend over to pick up poop however if the turd is soft it just smashed it into the teeth of the scoop. Sometimes it works if the turd is rock hard however anything else just get half picked up and the other half smashed into the scoop. Decent quality of the design just not great for all turds.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: This would work great if you live in the desert. Where poo dries instantly into solid little pebbles, sitting on top of the hard-packed earth. However, if you live where there's some moisture and some grass, this does a crappy job. I have to rip the grass out of the ground with the poo to get any of it up and even then, there's still a large pile that you have to dig up. I hope I can return this or get my money back because right now it's just a glaring display of buyer's remorse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like its suppose to!
customer_reviews.text: This saved my butt lol I was going to have to use hands (gloves) to pick up poo so I ordered this after research and it works great! You so have to clean it weekly with soft poop sticking to it and sometimes you gotta work the ones stuck to the ground or grass but it does its job and it's big so I don't have to bend over much at 5'2.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah mackey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this poop scoop! It is easy to use with one hand while carrying your bag and disposal can in the other. Even the sticky stuff came off pretty easy. Went through the whole yard in no time. Have a small and medium sized dog and even as he grows (now 21 lbs.) it will still be perfect size. I debated to get the large, but don't think I will need.
customer_reviews.author: drmanon

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is my favorite one yet! BUT I wish they would make the teeth out of metal so it would not break off the teeth so easy! I have a large dog and seems about every 3 months I need to start looking for a new one because the teeth always break off after a lot of use, then it doesn't work as well and I need a new one. But I like this one because it is longer than most and a nice big scoop :)
customer_reviews.author: Sassie

customer_reviews.title: Way easier than bending over and I personally hate using my hand in a baggie
customer_reviews.text: I use this every night when I walk my dog. Way easier than bending over and I personally hate using my hand in a baggie. It fouls me out. This is quick and easy. I bought a bigger one since my dog is around 75 pounds, but I found it was more cumbersome to walk with so I never really used it. This did replace the same model I bought at a local pet store. That one broke when we tried to scoop out of snow/ice. I can't really fault the design for that, though. I will buy again and happy scooping everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: Durability for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Better than every other scooper I’ve owned. Thick plastic and durable. Have used it weekly for months and it works like the day I bought it. Holding up to 3 dogs. Not cheap plastic and springs.
customer_reviews.author: John Knabe

customer_reviews.title: Pulls up grass, sore arm and shoulder bc of height
customer_reviews.text: Not good! The teeth on this pooper scooper interlock instead of having spaces where the teeth meet, like on my old one — it pulls out grass when I pick up poop. It’s also very tall (I am 5’4”), so my arm and shoulder get sore after picking up the whole yard and collecting poop in a bag. I used this 3x before I went and bought a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but needs better springs
customer_reviews.text: This would be 5 starts except for the springs. My first one had a spring break and it was not usable. I ordered another and a spring broke. Still usable though. Like one of the other folks I tried to get a replacement at a hardware store. No luck there. I am going to get another. I just sent an email to Nature's Miracle asking if I can get replacement springs. Advise if and when I get answer. What great service. Contacted Nature's Miracle and the sent me 2 springs. I am good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Ashcroft

customer_reviews.title: Bad Poop Picker Upper🥺❗️
customer_reviews.text: This is almost useless. It is virtually impossible to get the dog poop from the plastic holder into a poop bag. You would have to carry around a garbage receptacle and plop the poop into the container. And the poop often sticks to the plastic tool making it impossible to remove. Not a great invention☹️❗️
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Simon

customer_reviews.title: Broken on first use - unusable
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't even able to get 2 mins in with this product, there are plastic fasteners which keep the claws in place, mine apparently already had one broken in half so when you attempt to pickup anything, the claw is unable to properly close without popping out one side. As a result this product was unable to even serve it's purpose. Very disappointed with the build quality of this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works well, bit flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this scoop worked pretty well. I used it to pick up a winter's worth of poop from my back yard. Seemed to get it up pretty easy, although some of the fresher ones caked on the jaws a bit. Would need to be sprayed off a bit. Had to knock off a star because the hinge that controls one of the jaws lost a peg mid cleanup. Might be my fault since i tapped it a bit to get the poop off but shouldn't be that flimsy. Easy fix, just used a nail and bent it, but a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes cleaning behind my dog so much easier! I carry a small trashcan with a plastic bag inside and put the poo right in it. I never had to touch it in any way shape or form. The length is good for me. I'm about 5' with a bad back, so I can't lean over very much. This doesn't bother my back. I recommend getting one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I used the previous model (same brand) for over 10 years before the handle broke. This newer model is basically the same as the one it replaced, but the handle is a little different. Grasping it properly takes bigger hands than before, so it's not quite as easy for me to use but is still the best design out there.
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac scooper
customer_reviews.text: My flimsy old scoop broke after several years of use and it was only after I got this new Nature's Miracle scoop that I realized what I had been missing. This thing is very sturdy, though still light to carry, and works very well. It isn't exactly non-stick, but still a real advancement over what I was used to. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: WBF

customer_reviews.title: Quality Construction, Non-Stick = NO
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this scoop because it's very sturdy and does the job. However, the non-stick claim is totally bogus because I could post pictures of the dog waste sticking, but I'll save you the horror. With that said, I give it 3 stars for sturdy construction but I wouldn't buy it again because of the bogus claims of non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Da Bunkster

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: $30 one at the pet store lasted me 3 yrs (had to make some bandaid fixes but it lasted!) This one is half the price and looked to be nice - it works as expected. Very strong springs and clamp - really like the teeth design - seems to work slightly better than previous. Hoping it lasts over the yrs outside in the midwest!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: could be better
customer_reviews.text: cons are squeeze handles are too far apart (not easy to use) says non-stick but everything sticks to it (depleted purpose of disposing poop) plastic everything (not durable) pros are it can open wide springs seem stronger than my other scooper (useful if the poo is mixed in with grass or dandelions)
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty- but NOT non-stick
customer_reviews.text: These don't typically last but a few months at our house. The springs are the first thing to go. All of them use the most delicate pair of springs. This looks like a nice durable picker upper. It should last longer. It should not be advertised as non-stick because "stuff" does get stuck in the teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Great for picking up Poop!
customer_reviews.text: Works like an old steam shovel, the teeth on both sides grabs a pile of poop. i then throw the poop into my bushes. This is a well made product. You sqeeze the handle and the device opens up, then put the device over the pile and let go of the handle and the device closes, and the poop pile is loaded. Just bring to a bag or other place, squeeze the handle again and the poop is released. Like operating a well made toy crane.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Spak

customer_reviews.title: Great large claw for easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: So lucky! We looked at a ton of these online and ended up picking this one after getting burned out reading too many reviews. This product is great! Good sized for our 60-70 lbs dogs poops. The handle squeezes easy, which is good for my weak hands. It's also a good length. I'm about 5'4" and I barely have to lean. So far it's held together great, but we're pretty careful not to leave it out so it won't get rusty. We use Doggy Do Good biodegradable xl bags for it and they are a very good fit. Plus they'll usually get both dogs' waste in one bag! I definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: The Ones and Twos

customer_reviews.title: Great for poo and snakes!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this poo scoop because it's extra long and my husband is 6'3". I love it because it's super easy to grab the turds without bending over. I can scour our front yard weekly and not waste a ton of bags. Seeing as how my husband is poo averse, the only time he's actually used it is to pull giant black snakes out of our chicken coop. The extra long handle makes it less frightening, holding the snake at a distance and the super sharp teeth are perfect for clamping down on those slithering jerk's necks.
customer_reviews.author: Juperson

customer_reviews.title: A dirty job...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 3 out of 5 stars however, my husband hates it so much we had to meet in the middle. - This scoop does not work well on wet/fresh poop. The scoop makes the biggest mess. - Almost always has to me hosed off after every use. - I am upset that I found this item (the slightly smaller version) for $6 cheaper else where. This version is not worth the price. Please click YES if this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: M.Mae.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pooper-scooper. Our first lasted 8+ years outside. I got the Jumbo because the small would be too small. We have Labs and Heelers. It is not heavy, it is very sturdy and works smoothly. I love it... as much as you can love a pooper-scooper. The price on Amazon was the best and the brand is a well known are respected company. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Broken springs
customer_reviews.text: This scooper does exactly what it's supposed to. The only issues I have had with it are the springs breaking. This is probably my fault since I leave the scooper outside year round (rain, snow, heat, wind, everything!). The springs seem to always break on me in the winter time after about a year of use. Luckily when I contact the manufacturer on the company's website they have sent me replacement springs free of charge! The broken springs can be an annoyance but the customer service and functionality of the scooper makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carrington

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good overall.
customer_reviews.text: Quality of build seems good. Doesn’t do the best job of picking up fresh poop or poop in grass. It’ll get it, but takes some work. By non-stick, you must clean it right after use, if not it sticks on there. Kind of pulls up more grass than poop when I try to use it in my front yard. Does work excellent on frozen and older poop.
customer_reviews.author: MooseKnuckle

customer_reviews.title: We got many one good month of use. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: For nearly $30, I would have expected this to perform better. However, after a month one half of the bucket started to slip off the pin. This is what allowed it to push open and close tightly. Not exactly an area you'd like to touch to fix, but it went back in easily enough. After another 2months of that same side slipping off many times, it finally cracked and is unusable. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Q

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: --Feel free to ask me any questions about my review!-- This works really well. It's really sturdy and long so I don't have to bend over. It helps me clean up after my 100 lb chocolate lab. I hope my review was of use to you! --Follow @CassandraMercedes on Instagram for more Amazon finds!--
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Mercedes Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Strong, durable doo-doo grabber
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Aug 2016. It’s still (2018) working great despite keeping it out in the weather. Strong spring really grabs the poo; as with anything, you’ll improve technique with practice. I cannot think of any improvements for this item. Strong, durable, gets the job done. Update: in 2020 the springs finally broke (after this product has been stored outside in the elements and used regularly since 2016). I contacted the company to see about buying replacement springs. They do not sell the springs as an individual part, but they went above and beyond by sending me free spring replacements. That’s a great business action.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks. I have a small dog (i
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. I have a small dog (i.e., not very large poops) but he poops a lot and this thing is not efficient at all in picking it up. It doesn't pick up the whole pile, it sticks to the bottom so you can't get the poop out and you can only get like 2 piles at once. Worthless. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: denvergirl

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SCOOPER
customer_reviews.text: Having 5 adopted dogs, 2 of which are mastiffs, this is an essential tool to have. Big enough for the big piles, but works great on smaller ones. The dogs have over an acre of fenced yard, so I usually try to pick up 3 or 4 days a week, and this tool makes my job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Rescue Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best Pooper Scooper I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other scoops, and this one seems to work the best. I just replaced the last one I had that lasted for 3 years. It has strong springs and picks up the poop well, especially large ones which is important considering I own a Great Dane. Without bags, the poo can tend to build up on the scoop, making it harder to close it, but spraying it off with a hose works well. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rotchford

product_meta.title: Nature's Miracle Non-Stick Advanced Jaw Scoop
product_meta.description:
Color:Black & Red| Size:Jumbo

Nature's Miracle pet stain and odor removers have been a trusted brand for pet mess cleanup for more than 30 years. With the expansion to training aids, cat litter, disinfectants and other products, Nature’s Miracle brand can be trusted to provide innovative solutions to a range of pet problems.

Nature's Miracle Pet Wipes clean and groom your dog, cat, and other small animals safely and naturally, thoroughly moisturizing the pet's coat and paws. Use Nature's Miracle Pet Wipes to remove dirt from your pet's coat and paws after walks or before entering the house. These wipes can also be used to keep pets clean and fresh in between baths or on pets that are difficult to bathe. The wipes contain natural moisturizers which soften pet's coat, leaving it healthy and shiny. Pet wipes keep the pet cleaner, eliminating odor build-up and saving trips to the groomer!

Trust the miracle when finding solutions for a clean home and a happy, healthy pet.
feature_bullets: Lightweight and easy to use. Picks up from all Surfaces - Grass, gravel or concrete

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
